intro: Ligusticopsis pseudodaucoides, commonly known as the false cowparsley, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and compound leaves that resemble those of related species. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, shady environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
